metadata.Title: CVE-2022-0729 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
Use of Out-of-range Pointer Offset in GitHub repository vim/vim prior to 8.2.4440.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-0729` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

vim - 2:7.4.052-1ubuntu3.1+esm9
vim-athena - 2:7.4.052-1ubuntu3.1+esm9
vim-common - 2:7.4.052-1ubuntu3.1+esm9
vim-gnome - 2:7.4.052-1ubuntu3.1+esm9
vim-gtk - 2:7.4.052-1ubuntu3.1+esm9
vim-gui-common - 2:7.4.052-1ubuntu3.1+esm9
vim-lesstif - 2:7.4.052-1ubuntu3.1+esm9
vim-nox - 2:7.4.052-1ubuntu3.1+esm9
vim-runtime - 2:7.4.052-1ubuntu3.1+esm9
vim-tiny - 2:7.4.052-1ubuntu3.1+esm9
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: ccdm94> for bionic and earlier, vulnerable code is in file src/regexp.c instead of src/regexp_bt.c.

criterions.comment: vim package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:7.4.052-1ubuntu3.1+esm9').
